project.name: HEDTRONIX
project.description: A next-generation AI assistant that is terminal-native, offline-first, privacy-focused, and cross-platform
project.vision: Ubiquitous private AI companion across all devices with deterministic execution and enterprise-grade security

core_assistant.description: Terminal-native AI assistant with text and voice interface
acceptance_criteria: Responds to queries within <100ms for local inference
Processes both text and voice input simultaneously
Maintains conversation context across sessions
Works completely offline with core functionality

multi_modal_input.description: Support for keyboard, voice, and screen interaction inputs
acceptance_criteria: Push-to-talk voice recognition with Vosk offline STT
Keyboard shortcuts for all major functions
Screen interaction via pyautogui for UI automation
Simultaneous input mode handling without conflicts

hybrid_ai_inference.description: Local-first AI with optional cloud augmentation
acceptance_criteria: Local inference with LLaMA 2 7B quantized model (<4GB RAM)
Cloud fallback for complex queries with user consent
Deterministic reasoning chain execution
Model caching and quantization on-device
Ring buffer stores last 100 interactions in memory
Vector database for semantic search across all history
Encrypted persistent storage for session continuity
Memory query response <50ms for recent context

plugin_ecosystem.description: Extensible plugin system with capability security
acceptance_criteria: WASM sandbox for plugin execution
Capability-based permission system
Hot-reload plugins without restart
Plugin marketplace with signed packages
End-to-end encrypted sync via libp2p
Conflict resolution with vector timestamping
Delta synchronization for bandwidth efficiency
QR code pairing for device setup

security.data_encryption: AES-256-GCM for storage, TLS 1.3 for transport
security.privacy: Zero data sent to cloud without explicit consent
security.access_control: Capability tokens for all external access

user_stories.scenario: As a developer working with sensitive code
user_stories.need: I want to ask AI questions about my proprietary codebase
user_stories.so_that: I can get assistance without exposing intellectual property
acceptance_tests: AI processes local files without network calls
No telemetry or analytics data leaves device

user_stories.scenario: As a researcher in remote areas without internet
user_stories.need: I need AI assistance for data analysis and note-taking
user_stories.so_that: I can work productively without connectivity

user_stories.scenario: As a security officer in regulated industry
user_stories.need: I need audit trails and access controls for AI usage
user_stories.so_that: We remain compliant with data protection regulations
acceptance_tests: All interactions logged with tamper-evident storage

user_stories.scenario: As a professional using laptop, phone, and tablet
user_stories.need: I want seamless context sharing across all my devices
user_stories.so_that: My AI assistant knows what I was doing on any device
acceptance_tests: Context syncs within 30 seconds of device coming online
Sync works over local WiFi without cloud

user_stories.scenario: As a user with visual impairment
user_stories.need: I need complete voice interaction and screen reader support
user_stories.so_that: I can use the AI assistant independently
acceptance_tests: All functions accessible via voice commands

prolonged_offline.description: Device offline for 30+ days with heavy usage
prolonged_offline.handling: LRU eviction from vector DB, ring buffer maintained, encrypted storage expands as needed
prolonged_offline.recovery: Incremental sync prioritizes recent changes when back online

low_storage.handling: Auto-cleanup of oldest vector embeddings, compress ring buffer, warn user

simultaneous_edits.description: Same memory entry modified on two devices while offline
simultaneous_edits.resolution: Vector clock with last-write-wins, conflict tombstone stored for manual review
simultaneous_edits.algorithm: CRDT-based conflict-free replicated data types for memory entries

clock_skew.handling: Lamport timestamps for logical ordering, NTP sync on connection
clock_skew.tolerance: ±5 minutes corrected automatically, beyond requires manual sync

model_corruption.description: Local AI model file becomes corrupted
model_corruption.handling: SHA-256 verification on load, auto-redownload from trusted source, fallback to tiny model

inference_timeout.handling: Timeout with progressive fallback: smaller model → cached response → error message

plugin_malware.description: Plugin attempts privilege escalation or data exfiltration
plugin_malware.handling: WASM memory isolation, capability revocation, automatic quarantine, alert user
plugin_malware.containment: Network isolation, filesystem sandbox, syscall filtering

physical_compromise.handling: Remote wipe capability, encryption keys protected by hardware security module when available
physical_compromise.protection: Rate-limited decryption attempts, secure element storage for keys on supported devices

vector_index_maintenance.description: Rebuild vector index for semantic search

error_handling.fallback: Continue with existing index if rebuild fails

encrypted_backup.description: Create encrypted backups of persistent storage
actions: Rotate old backups (keep last 7 daily, 4 weekly)

model_optimization.description: Optimize AI models for current device
actions: Update model registry with new version
Attempt P2P connection to known devices

system_errors.handling: Log with stack trace, attempt recovery, degrade gracefully

ai_errors.handling: Fallback to simpler model, use cached responses, prompt user

network_errors.handling: Queue for retry, switch to offline mode, validate certificates

stateful_services.user_sessions: Redis Cluster with hash slot migration

environments.ci: full test suite on every PR

build.caching: layer caching for docker, ccache for native

mobile_app.justification: Cross-platform with native performance, iOS 26 design system compliance

state_management.justification: Simpler than Redux, built-in immutable updates, excellent TypeScript support

core_orchestrator.justification: Memory safety, performance, async/await for concurrent AI operations

ai_orchestration.justification: Rich AI/ML ecosystem, async support, easy integration with ML libraries

event_system.justification: High-performance messaging, persistence, exactly-once delivery guarantees

primary.justification: Reliability, JSON support, time-series capabilities for metrics

vector.justification: Production-ready vector database, GPU acceleration, distributed architecture

cache.justification: In-memory performance, data structures for queues and pub/sub

embedded.justification: Zero-configuration, serverless, perfect for offline-first mobile

container_orchestration.justification: Managed Kubernetes, integration with AWS ecosystem, enterprise support

service_mesh.justification: Traffic management, security, observability for microservices

monitoring.justification: CNCF standards, rich ecosystem, correlation between metrics/logs/traces

ci_cd.justification: Tight GitHub integration, reusable workflows, matrix builds

development.justification: Consistent environments, remote development, extensive extensions

testing.framework: Playwright for E2E, Jest for unit
testing.justification: Cross-browser testing, reliable selectors, parallel execution

font_families.primary: SF Pro Display with optical sizing
font_families.secondary: SF Pro Rounded for UI elements
